* TODO When running bisos-startup, you will be prompted for keyboard selection. What package and how to automate
SCHEDULED: <2025-09-04 Thu>
* TODO To go in as dockeruser and then sudo --login bystar x11 won't work - The fix is:
- cp ~dockeruser.Xauthorize to ~/bystar and set the permissions
- export DISPLAY=$(sameAsDockeruser)
- Run blee
SCHEDULED: <2025-09-04 Thu>
* TODO braughtg gets xfce right, but noVnc wrong. piopi Gets noVnc right.
SCHEDULED: <2025-09-04 Thu>
* TODO Terminalsrc Causes some sort of problem.
* TODO Missing novnc launch.sh
- Logs Reads:
  rm: cannot remove '/tmp/.X11-unix/X1': No such file or directory
rm: cannot remove '/tmp/.X1-lock': No such file or directory

New Xtigervnc server '6262a1e21cab:1 (dockeruser)' on port 5901 for display :1.
Use xtigervncviewer -SecurityTypes None 6262a1e21cab:1 to connect to the VNC server.

.contconf/startup.bash: line 15: /usr/share/novnc/utils/launch.sh: No such file or directory
- Something along these lines is a fix:
  Simply extracting the file, isn't enough, as it assumes a websockify executable is in the same folder as the script. Applying this diff, changes the call to make the call as long as websockify is on the path, this makes it work perfectly happily along with the existing websockify package (wherein the websockify executable is installed into /usr/bin).

30a31,32
> #WEBSOCKIFY=${HERE}/websockify
> WEBSOCKIFY=websockify
105c107
< ${HERE}/websockify --web ${WEB} ${CERT:+--cert ${CERT}} ${PORT} ${VNC_DEST} &
---
> ${WEBSOCKIFY} --web ${WEB} ${CERT:+--cert ${CERT}} ${PORT} ${VNC_DEST} &
-----------------

SCHEDULED: <2025-09-04 Thu>
